page.title: 12MANCETTER QUARRIES
page.content:
The Quarries at Mancetter have been mined since the late 19th cent. They are now owned by Tilcon. The rock from the quarries is Diorite or Basalt and Stockingford Shale. About 3,000 tons are quarried per day. The rock has to be drilled, exploded, sorted and collected. The larger rocks have to be crushed.
Most of the material is bought by Local Authorities for Roadworks. The Quarry also makes and supplies Tarmac for road surfacing. The Quarry employs 29 people and is expected to last for another 15-20 years. When a Quarry is exhausted it may be filled in and returned to agriculture or flooded and used for fishing and Water Sports.
